title: Florida Republicans Oust State Party Chairman Facing Rape Allegations In Critical Election Year
description: A majority of about 200 members approved the ouster in a voice vote.

title: Realtor Group President Resigns After Blackmail Threat
description: The president of the National Association of Realtors, Tracy Kasper, is stepping down.

title: Lloyd Austin’s Surgery Blunder May Have Compromised National Security
description: The Pentagon is refusing to say whether the Defense Secretary was put under anesthesia or lost consciousness.

title: Microplastics in Bottled Water At Least 10 Times Worse Than Once Thought
description: New research reveals that a liter of bottled water contains an average 240,000 microscopic plastic particles. The health impact is unclear.

title: Al Jazeera Journalist Whose Family Was Killed in Airstrike Loses Another Son
description: Since the war began, at least 79 journalists have been killed–72 were Palestinian, four Israeli, and three Lebanese.

title: The Current Migrant Crisis is a Collective Trauma
description: When we validate and recognize the history of oppression Venezuelan immigrants have experienced, we give them hope, writes Dr. Edith Shiro.

title: The Golden Globes Monologue Was Bad—But One Joke in Particular Sank Jo Koy
description: The comedian's hosting job was widely criticized, but a joke that seemed to miss the entire point of 'Barbie' enraged viewers most of all.

title: Jonathan Majors Says He Was ‘Shocked’ by Guilty Verdict in First Interview Since Assault Conviction
description: Jonathan Majors spoke in his first interview after being convicted on assault and harassment charges in December.

title: Why Netanyahu Can’t Talk About Post-War Gaza
description: Israel’s plan for the so-called “day after” the war ends in Gaza has remained elusive as Netanyahu faces political vulnerability.

title: Tiger Woods and Nike Split After More than 27 Years
description: Woods in a social media post thanked Nike co-founder Phil Knight for his “passion and vision."

title: U.S. Company Says Its Moon Landing Attempt Is in Jeopardy Because of an Engine Problem
description: Astrobotic Technology's newly launched spacecraft developed engine trouble.

title: How Attacks in the Red Sea Could Increase Costs of Items from Clothing to Coffee
description: How the Houthi attacks on vessels in the Red Sea could increase costs of items from clothing to coffee to electronics worldwide.

title: I’m Young and Healthy. Should I Take Paxlovid?
description: Do lower-risk people stand to benefit at all from the COVID-19 treatment?

title: Putin’s War Against My Marriage
description: The Kremlin is waging a campaign against LGBTQ rights in Russia, especially my public marriage, writes Mikhail Zygar.

title: Inside the Nuclear Fusion Facility That Changed the World
description: TIME followed government scientists in the year after they achieved the biggest scientific breakthrough of the decade—successful fusion.

title: Why Are Lefty Quarterbacks Like Michael Penix Jr. Still So Rare?
description: According to Hall of Famer Steve Young, “football is biased against lefties"

title: Franklin Roosevelt’s Case for American Military Aid for Ukraine
description: In a famous speech, Roosevelt explained why helping an ally facing aggression is necessary to safeguard American security and prosperity.

title: The Top 10 Global Risks for 2024
description: From U.S. political dysfunction to the axis of rogues, Ian Bremmer breaks down the world's biggest risks for 2024.

title: First U.S. Lunar Lander in 50 Years Blasts Off Toward the Moon
description: Astrobiotic Technology's lander caught a ride on United Launch Alliance's Vulcan. An attempted moon landing is expected on Feb. 23.

title: Ecuador’s ‘Most Wanted’ Criminal Has Disappeared From Prison: What to Know
description: Authorities say over 3,000 law enforcement personnel are now searching for the notorious gang leader José Adolfo Macías Villamar, or “Fito.”

title: Barack Obama, John Mulaney, Carol Burnett Among Winners of Creative Arts Emmy Awards
description: Joining the former President, John Mulaney, Carol Burnett, Keke Palmer, Nick Offerman, and Ed Sheeran also took home awards at the ceremony that mostly honors less-than-famous artists, crew members and crafts people in television.

title: China Claims It Caught a Foreign Consultant Spying for the U.K.’s MI6
description: Beijing has ratcheted up efforts to crack down on spying and adopted a new counter-espionage law that has intensified the risks for foreign firms.

title: Bangladesh’s Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina Extends Rule After Overwhelming Victory in Election Opposition Deemed Unfair
description: Critics and rights groups say the vote follows a troubling pattern of allegations of vote-rigging and a boycott by opposition parties.

title: The Best and Worst Moments of the 2024 Golden Globe Awards
description: All the highlights from the 81st Golden Globes

title: Surge in Unwanted Dogs Fuels ’Crisis’ Across U.S. Animal Shelters
description: With more workers heading back to the office and pet essentials like food and veterinary care prices swelling, the number of dogs taken in by shelters has climbed drastically.

title: Congressional Leaders Reach Deal on 2024 Spending to Avoid Government Shutdown
description: Congressional leaders have reached an agreement on overall spending levels for the current fiscal year that could help avoid a partial government shutdown later this month.

title: Pentagon Releases More Details About Secretary Lloyd Austin’s Secretive Hospitalization
description: Members of both parties have expressed sharp concerns about the secrecy of the hospital stay and the fact that the President and other senior leaders were kept in the dark about it for days.
